brief_summary.textblock:
This study is intended to collect safety and effectiveness data on the Cook Micronized Small
      Intestinal Submucosa (SIS)

clinical_study.brief_title: Cook Micronized Small Intestinal Submucosa (SIS) for Critical Limb Ischemia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Rutherford stage 4 or 5 or Leriche-Fontaine classification IIIB

          -  Patient is unable to be treated by endovascular or surgical means

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patient is pregnant or breastfeeding

          -  Patient has had a previous surgery within 30 days of the study   procedure

          -  Patient has a planned surgical or interventional procedure within 30 days after the
             study procedure

          -  Patient has a life expectancy of less than 1 year

          -  Patient has a known allergy to pigs or pig products, or has a religious or cultural
             objection to the use of pig tissue.

          -  Additional restrictions as specified in the protocol

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Safety Study of Micronized Small Intestinal Submucosa (SIS) for Critical Limb Ischemia

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency and types of adverse events

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
